questions.question: Rhode Island minister Roger Williams clashed with Puritan leaders in Massachusetts because

choices.answer: he believed people should not be persecuted for their religious practices
he argued that settlers should take as much land as possible from natives
his views were considered too harsh and intolerant

questions.question: Maryland was originally a colony for English who were what?
What English colony is famous for its disappearance?
The House of Burgesses allowed colonists the ability to make their own laws and

choices.answer: make taco Tuesday an official holiday

questions.question: Bacon's Rebellion was a sign that colonists could not be limited. Which of the following is not a correct answer?

choices.answer: be limited to the land by the coast.
be stopped in the movement west from the coast
be stopped by governments of the colonies from moving west.
be stopped from eating their bacon.

questions.question: The English wanted to acquire the Dutch colony of New Netherlands because

choices.answer: it had an excellent harbor and a thriving river trade
they wanted to free the Dutch colonists
England and the Netherlands declared war
The Dutch refused to trade with the English.

questions.question: Why did William Penn want to create Pennsylvania?

choices.answer: He wanted a place to freely practice his religious beliefs.
He wanted to get rich from the resources of the new world.
He wanted to become the supreme ruler of the Americas
He wanted a place to stage a revolution against England.

questions.question: Puritans hoped to reform the Anglican Church but the Separatists or Pilgrims hoped to

choices.answer: find a new route to India

questions.question: Why was the Mayflower Compact important?

choices.answer: It pledged to create an independent nation.
It pledged the Mayflower would never be boarded back to England
It pledged their loyalty to England
It pledged Plymouth as an area of religious freedom

questions.question: The Great Awakening was a movement to do what?

choices.answer: War against the French and Indians

questions.question: The Enlightenment was a movement to do what?

choices.answer: War against the French and Indians

questions.question: The French and Indian War was what?

choices.answer: War against the French and Indians
War against the French and Indians

questions.question: What group of colonies was centered around landowning/slave owning elite?
What group of colonies focused on sustaining themselves and religious and political freedom?
What group of colonies focused on shipping and enforcing a strict religious society?
